p: Fresh leaves and fruit peels of Citrus paradisi (350 g each) were hydrodistilled using the Clevenger apparatus for 4 h to obtain essential oils [ 17]. Plant parts were distilled immediately after harvesting, while the dried plant parts were obtained by air-drying the fresh plant parts at room temperature over a period of two weeks. The essential oils were placed in closed vials and stored in a cool dry place [ 22].
